image.alt: Patients smiling in the Eagan Orthodontics office

paragraphs.text: Welcome to Eagan Orthodontics, a third‑generational orthodontic practice creating beautiful, confident smiles in the metropolitan Detroit area since 1955. Our dedicated team determines the best treatment solution for each patient and offers a wide variety of innovative treatment options (including Damon braces and clear aligners) using the latest orthodontic advancements.

items.title: Family Legacy
items.text: Third‑generation practice serving metro Detroit since 1955, carrying a long family tradition of orthodontic care.

items.title: Advanced Options
items.text: Damon® self‑ligating braces and modern clear aligner options for more comfortable treatment and often fewer visits.

items.title: Flexible Financing
items.text: Patient‑focused in‑house financing and clear guidance to make orthodontic treatment affordable for families.

items.title: Family Atmosphere
items.text: We are a family serving families, with patient testimonials and videos that highlight our caring, welcoming culture.

paragraphs.text: Dr. J. Victor Eagan leads the practice and has guided the Eagan Orthodontics legacy of “Creating Beautiful Smiles with Braces.” Son of Dr. John Eagan, Michigan’s first African American orthodontist, Dr. Eagan holds a DDS from the University of Michigan (with honors) and completed orthodontic specialty training at Howard University as valedictorian. He is active in the American Dental Association, the American Association of Orthodontists and local civic organizations, and is also an ordained minister and published author.

Dr. Javen Durham completed his DDS and orthodontic specialty training at Howard University and brings a modern perspective to the practice. Nephew of Dr. J. Victor Eagan and the first third‑generation African American orthodontist in the world, Dr. Durham continues the family tradition. He earned an undergraduate degree in Applied Physiology and Kinesiology from the University of Florida and enjoys outdoor adventures when not caring for patients.
We offer a full range of orthodontic care for children, teens and adults, including Damon® braces, traditional metal and ceramic options, and clear aligners.

testimonials.author: Farrita Jackson
testimonials.testimonial: “I am a proud client at Eagan Orthodontics. The staff displays the same spiritual attitudes. Their welcoming once they see their clients is so genuine and make one feel so special. Great job to Dr. Eagan and his staff!”

image.alt: Parents with kids relaxing in front of home

og_meta.title: Eagan Orthodontics, P.C.
og_meta.description: Third‑generation orthodontic care in metro Detroit offering Damon® braces, ceramic options and clear aligners with a family-focused approach.

image.alt: Historic and current team photo at Eagan Orthodontics

paragraphs.text: Thank you for visiting Eagan Orthodontics. Founded in 1955, our third‑generation practice has spent decades creating healthy, confident smiles for families across the metropolitan Detroit area.
Our dedicated team combines experience with modern orthodontic techniques to recommend the right treatment for each patient. We focus on personalized care delivered in a warm, respectful environment.
We offer a full range of services, from traditional braces to advanced systems, using the latest orthodontic advancements to improve comfort, efficiency, and results.
Whether you’re a child, teen, or adult, our goal is the same: create beautiful smiles that support long‑term oral health while making care accessible and convenient for your family.

image.alt: Dr. J. Victor Eagan smiling portrait

paragraphs.text: Dr. J. Victor Eagan, DDS, is a practicing orthodontist with a long family legacy in the specialty. He brings decades of clinical experience and a focus on using modern, state‑of‑the‑art equipment to deliver consistent, high‑quality care.
Dr. Eagan is a member of the American Dental Association, National Dental Association, Great Lakes Association of Orthodontists, and the American Association of Orthodontists.

Dr. Eagan completed his undergraduate studies and earned his Doctor of Dental Surgery with honors from the University of Michigan. After eight years in general dentistry, he pursued specialty training in orthodontics at Howard University School of Dentistry, graduating as valedictorian.
His advanced training and long career have informed a thoughtful approach to treatment planning and an emphasis on lasting, healthy results.

image.alt: Historical image representing Dr. Eagan's education and career

paragraphs.text: Dr. Eagan has been recognized with multiple honors, including Orthodontist of the Year (1996), the Jeann R. Vogt Celebration of Leadership Award (1997), an Outstanding Scientific Award (1998), and a Top Dentist recognition from HOUR Detroit (2009).
Outside the practice, Dr. Eagan is an ordained minister, author, and international speaker. He lives with his wife, Catherine, and remains active in community and civic organizations.

Dr. Javen Durham earned his undergraduate degree in Applied Physiology and Kinesiology from the University of Florida and his Doctor of Dental Surgery from Meharry Medical College School of Dentistry in Nashville, TN.
He completed advanced specialty training in orthodontics at Howard University School of Dentistry in May 2022.

As the first third‑generation African American orthodontist in the world, Dr. Durham continues the family tradition of clinical excellence. He focuses on braces and modern orthodontic methods to create functional, long‑lasting smiles.

When he’s not treating patients, Dr. Durham enjoys outdoor adventures and thrill‑seeking activities like skydiving and travel. He is eager to help continue the practice’s legacy of creating beautiful smiles.

image.alt: Dr. John P. Eagan historical portrait

paragraphs.text: Dr. John P. Eagan graduated from Meharry School of Dentistry in 1952 and established the practice in Michigan in 1955, becoming the state’s first African American orthodontist.
His work laid the foundation for a family legacy in orthodontics that continues at Eagan Orthodontics today.

paragraphs.text: Eagan Orthodontics has a long history of civic leadership and community engagement. The practice supports local events and partners with organizations to give back to the communities we serve.

We host patient events like Deband Day, a monthly celebration for patients who complete braces treatment. These events are a joyful way to mark progress and welcome families into our practice community.

image.alt: Deband Day event with smiling patients

paragraphs.text: Receive a Virtual Appointment from Eagan Orthodontics. Available for new and existing patients: fill out a simple form, upload a few photos, and our team will review your case and get back to you with next steps.
Powered by Orthodontic Screening, the virtual consult is fast and convenient — a great way to begin your treatment without an office visit.

image.alt: Father with daughter at reception of dentist's surgery

paragraphs.text: While you are wearing braces, avoid hard foods, sticky foods, and anything high in sugar. Hard and crunchy items can break brackets or bend wires; sticky candies and caramels can get caught under wires and pull brackets off.

Cut crunchy fruits and vegetables into small pieces, skip gum and hard candies, and limit sugary drinks. Check your braces regularly for loose wires or brackets, and call us if you notice damage. Start your Virtual Appointment: Click Here!

Thank you for your interest in Eagan Orthodontics. Please complete the appointment request form with your contact details and preferred days/times. A team member will reach out to confirm your appointment and answer any questions.

image.alt: Patient filling out orthodontic health history forms online

og_meta.title: Get Started | Eagan Orthodontics
og_meta.description: Begin at Eagan Orthodontics: request appointments, complete new-patient forms, review first-visit steps, or start a virtual consult today.

paragraphs.text: Metal braces remain a reliable, cost-effective choice. Modern brackets are smaller and more comfortable than in the past, and they consistently deliver predictable tooth movement for children, teens, and adults.

image.alt: Close-up of traditional metal braces on teeth

paragraphs.text: Ceramic brackets blend with your tooth color for a less noticeable appearance. They offer an aesthetic option for patients who want effective treatment with a softer visual profile.

Self-ligating brackets use a built-in mechanism instead of elastic ties, which can reduce friction and the need for frequent adjustments. Systems like Damon may help shorten appointments and improve comfort for many patients.
Clear aligners are removable trays that progressively move teeth with a series of custom-fitted appliances. They offer a discreet option that lets you brush and eat without bracket restrictions.

image.alt: Clear aligner tray held by hand

paragraphs.text: Aligner systems designed for teens include features such as compliance indicators and replacement options. They can be an excellent, nearly invisible choice when consistent wear is maintained.

Lingual braces are bonded to the back surfaces of the teeth so they are not visible from the front. They provide a fully hidden fixed option, though they can be more challenging to adapt to and may cost more than traditional braces.

image.alt: Illustration of lingual braces attached behind teeth

paragraphs.text: Palatal expanders gently widen the upper jaw when growth is favorable, helping to correct crossbites and create space for crowded teeth. Early use can reduce the need for more complex treatment later.

image.alt: Palatal expander in a patient's mouth

paragraphs.text: Retention is the final phase that protects your new smile. We provide custom retainers — removable Hawley-style, clear aligner-type, or bonded fixed retainers — and clear guidance on wear and care to help keep results long term.

image.alt: Various types of orthodontic retainers displayed

paragraphs.text: Find answers to common questions about braces, foods to avoid, emergency care, first-visit items, and patient forms at Eagan Orthodontics.

accordion.header: Are there any foods I cannot eat while I have braces?

paragraphs.text: Yes. Once treatment begins, we will explain our complete instructions and provide you with a comprehensive list of foods to avoid. Some of those foods include ice, hard candy, raw vegetables and all sticky foods (i.e. caramel and taffy). You can avoid most repair appointments by carefully following our instructions!

image.alt: Happy family portrait at the orthodontic office

accordion.header: Which sticky, hard, or sugary foods should I avoid?

paragraphs.text: Avoid hard foods, sticky foods, and items high in sugar. Examples from our guidance include gum, licorice, toffee, caramels, ice, nuts, hard taco shells, bagels, chips, uncut apples and carrots, and hard candies. Minimize sodas and sweetened drinks to reduce the risk of decay.

image.alt: Couple enjoying time together in a bright clinic

accordion.header: What should I do if a bracket or wire breaks or pokes?

paragraphs.text: Many problems are minor and manageable at home. If a band or bracket is still attached to the wire, leave it in place and don’t attach elastics to it. Cover irritating metal with orthodontic wax. For a poking wire, try moving it with a pencil eraser or Q‑Tip; if it won’t move, call the office. Save any loose parts and we’ll schedule a repair appointment.

accordion.header: What should I bring to my first appointment?

paragraphs.text: Bring any panoramic X‑ray taken within the past six months and your orthodontic insurance card if you have coverage. At the first visit we’ll review your history, evaluate your bite, and discuss treatment options and estimated costs.

image.alt: Clinician reviewing treatment options with a patient

accordion.header: Where can I find patient forms and authorizations?

paragraphs.text: Patient forms include an authorization confirming the accuracy of your information, consent to release records for insurance claims, and agreement to financial responsibility for any amounts not covered by insurance. You can complete forms before your visit and start a virtual appointment here: https://www.orthoscreening.com/screening/start?code=895JE5&sid=mljjr8eb-be444045-5917-awc6zmjgn&puid=be444045-5917-4fbd-8f22-88dd8ca5174f&step=0
